thread.title: Watch: Our Editor Tried to Hang at Sub-2 Hour Pace
thread.title_full: Watch: Our Editor Tried to Hang at Sub-2 Hour Pace

author: bdalek1
title: Watch: Our Editor Tried to Hang at Sub-2 Hour Pace
text:
Privacy Policy | About Us 
To give a sense of how difficult that is, Nike on Tuesday invited members of the media, including Runner's World contributing editor Alex Hutchinson , to chase a Tesla for a quarter mile at 4:35 pace. 
The results weren’t pretty. Hutchinson, who competed as a national-class runner for Canada for a decade, started strong, but knew he was out of his league. As were all of his media colleagues. Contributing editor Alex Hutchinson (black shirt, black shorts) chases a pace car moving at sub-two hour marathon pace on the Formula One circuit track in Monza, Italy. Chris Lawrence 
“I will say, for the record, I could have gone a little bit longer. But not for a whole lot longer,” Hutchinson said. “I’ve run at this pace before, but it’s still a really sobering experience to see what feels like a sprint that you you could maintain for a minute or two, that [elite runners] are going to do for two hours.” 
The media run was part of the half-marathon test run Nike staged in Monza, Italy, for the three athletes it’s training to break the two-hour marathon .
